pros: Strong administrative leadership, excellent students

review_title: Great place to work, as long as you never challenge standard paradigms
pros: Great students and colleagues good benefits great city, beautiful campus
cons: Performative administration that does not understand diversity or innovative work that does not fit their narrow conceptions. University does not recognize the value of working with other institutions. Claims to value diversity but disdains diversity of ideas. Loves people who look "diverse" as long as they think like white, cis gender, straight Christians.

pros: Great people and beautiful campus
cons: low wages and lack of advancement opportunities

pros: Furman is a very close community.  It is a place where people enjoy going to work, sharing their lives with one another, and developing their students.  Teamwork and collaborating across various functions is encouraged as well as personal and professional development.  The foundation of being successful is building relationships and in the atmosphere, it is easy to do.   Life-work balance is very important at Furman. Supervisors are accommodating to employees that must leave early or step out for school meetings, a sick child, etc because they understand that you will work hard and that you'll make up the hours at some time.
cons: A cost-benefit analysis  shows that there are many more benefits than costs.  Wages and salaries are often lower than competitors but the work is usually rewarding enough that one doesn't mind.  Expectations are high, but they are often self-imposed and one must fit in with the culture in order to be successful.  It is not enough that you just do a good job.  You can do a superb job and if others do not believe you are a good, friendly, or ethical person, you will not be rewarded as highly as you should.    There is not anything extremely negative to say.

pros: Beautiful campus and nice location
cons: Underpaid for the amount of work they expect

review_title: My experience as Furman University started great with many hopes of advancement, 4 years later no advancement.
pros: Flexibility in work schedule, Balanced work/family life, friendly employees
cons: Low pay, stagnant salaries, benefit costs have risen extremely over the stagnent salaries, growth opportunities are slim to none, promotions are based soley on who you know and who owes someone a favor

review_title: Onboarding process is poor. Lots of long-term employees who love working at Furman. Located in an outstanding community.
pros: LOCATION!  Fine university rated as a best places to work 5 years in a row.  Professional development opportunities. Competitive salaries and rich insured benefits and rich time off benefits.
cons: Onboarding is poor.  Sink or swim to adjust. The need to hold down tuition and boost enrollment is beginning to strain the budget and take a toll on employees.

pros: Beautiful campus, good students, good retirement plan, good faculty and staff, and it is located in a growing city (Greenville).
cons: Furman has had some leadership challenges over the past few years, and it still seems to be groping for its strategic direction. With new leadership, this will (hopefully) be addressed.

pros: As a student working on campus is ideal. Most departments recognize your class and social needs and allow you to plan your hours to fit with your life. Good pay with good hours without being overworked. Oftentimes the full-time employees at furman will help students land jobs for summers and after school.
cons: Student workers are often paid pretty low wages. Good for weekly spending money but not much else. For students who do not have the financial support of parents, working on campus will not necessarily give you the biggest pay out.

pros: Safe, clean, and non-stressful environment.  Great benefits if they apply.  Has a brand established that seems to never deteriorate until recently. Social media may finally show it's true colors.
cons: Have some great people doing all the work and others just coasting along riding the system. Very hard to make ends meet financially if you can't take advantage of the tuition assistance or insurance. No where to advance.

pros: Good students; small class sizes; beautiful campus; nice athletic facilities; very helpful librarians;
cons: Overall, the environment is very conservative, both politically and socially, and therefore, there is a tension between many campus groups. Also, this conservatism has the potential to interfere with the academic development of the various departments and the university curriculum. Faculty members have been allowed to design classes and seminars based on their own personal dogma, which will not benefit the scholastic training of the students.

pros: Great opportunity for growth. Enjoyed meeting and working with the individuals that I met. Intelligent people with good hearts
cons: No cons that I can think of. Like I said I had a great experience. Maybe something fun to do around the campus/-area that I live but that's it

pros: Some of the best and dedicated students in SC, wonderful faculty, colleagues, a great environment on campus, and some of the most enjoyable time teaching part-time.
cons: As in many other places of higher learning - a reliance on adjuncts stunts growth and potential achievements of the departments. But the lack of funding is an ultimate issue.

review_title: Tight nit community but lots of changes coming
pros: Great community feel, lots of support from management, flexible schedule and great benefits.  The opportunity to attend classes is also a great bonus.  And the Furman network is very supportive.
cons: Wages are not great, and the university is in acting a lot of budget cuts halting any hope of a raise.

pros: If you're a Furman student and need work, Furman has great opportunities for working part time while you're enrolled. The staff are very accommodating and provide lots of opportunities for you to apply what you know.
cons: Pay is low. Working as a student, you don't get much more than minimum wage.

pros: Work-study program is flexible with hours and allows some study time. Some positions offer good pay and pay increase over the years.
cons: Requires you to be eligible for the scholarship-- you must demonstrate financial need. However, this is helpful for those who do have financial need in securing a position.

pros: Studying at Furman is a rewarding and enriching experience. The faculty and staff are incredibly helpful and flexible. I would recommend this school to anyone.
cons: The small school atmosphere sometimes feels a little high school. Greek life is not strong or prevelenthere so if that's something you're looking for-look elsewhere.

pros: Payments are always on time and the staff that you work with are very friendly. Students are always in need of tutoring, so you set your own hours.
cons: Pay structure changed nearly every year that I was there

job_title: Research Assistant/Circulation Desk in Greenville, SC
pros: Very friendly supervisors, ability to get school work done during slow hours, easy to change shifts if there is a time conflict
cons: I didn't have any complaints - felt like I lucked into the best student job on campus

pros: $10 and hour for easy work, if labs end early you still get paid in full. Log your own hours. Get paid for setup.
